required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: OH2 Oncolytic Viral Therapy Via Transcatheter Intraarterial Infusion in Patients With Advanced Liver Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-label, Dose Escalation Study to Evaluate the Safety ,Tolerance and Pharmacokinetics of OH2 Via Transcatheter Intraarterial Infusion in Patients With Advanced Liver Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: An open-label dose-escalation phase I clinical study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of OH2 injection via transcatheter Intraarterial infusion in patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma

primary_outcome.description: Toxic reactions according to the NCI-CTCAE 5.0 grading standard that occur within 3 weeks from the first administration, are judged to be drug-related by the investigator, and meet the non-hematological toxicity and hematological toxicity conditions specified in the clinical protocol
If ≥2/6 subjects developed DLT, the previous dose group was MTD

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AE (Adverse Event) and SAE (Serious Adverse Event)
secondary_outcome.description: According to the NCI-CTCAE 5.0 grading standard
The assessment result is the number and proportion of subjects with complete response + partial response.
The assessment result is the number and proportion of subjects with complete response + partial response + stable disease.
The overall survival for each patient receiving OH2 will be calculated.
Time after OH2 administration to clinical and radiographic disease progression will be evaluated.

intervention.description: OH2 injection administered by transcatheter Intraarterial infusion

facility.name: Tongji Hospital, Tongji Medical College of Huazhong University of Science and Technology
